intro: Euscaphis fukienensis, commonly known as the Fukien hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern China. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray-brown bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers in early spring, followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds and mammals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas, contributing to local biodiversity.
